page.title: 10Sandford's Quarry
page.content: Sandford's quarry comprises a number of gravel extraction works. One is privately owned, and the majority is worked by Redland Aggregates. Their total holding was 109 acres. All but 40 acres are now exhausted. The remaining gravel deposits are expected to last until 1989. These lie 14ft. below ground level, and the strata are about 15ft. thick. 165000 tons are extracted annually. There are 9 people employed, most of whom worked previously on local farms. The eight lorry drivers are self-employed. When the area is worked out, it is returned to agriculture, and has a high degree of fertility. Two lakes 4 acres in extent have been formed, trees have been planted around and fishing is available for local people.
